channel.title: Auxy label in the works!
channel.description:
Hello everyone! It’s Obex G here!
So I’m thinking of making my own label. I do not have a name yet and I’m still figuring out the brand/label picture. (Which I probably will soon.) Here are the rules and how I’m thinking my label would work:
**RULES:** you have to have more than 100 followers on SoundCloud. Next, DM/PM me via SoundCloud or right here on the disco if it interests you to be a part of it! Next, I would like to post a playlist of the most popular fresh pressed tracks each month on my label. ONLY ten to twelve people can participate. I will be in it too.
If any of you have questions about this Auxy label I will be happy to answer!

item.title: Auxy label in the works!
item.dc:creator: HYDRANS
item.description:
Thanks for clearing that up.

However, in my opinion, it would make a lot more sense to accept submissions from everyone, and not just a limited group

Read full topic

item.title: Auxy label in the works!
item.dc:creator: obexg
item.description:
Hey everyone! Sorry for the confusion. So, I was thinking about this and what @HYDRANS said.
@Arimyth yes I like your feedback and yes that is true. I will make changes as we go. And @Mr_Mooo
I will send you all the details when I feel good about what is in the process.

  1. This is all in the works so i am figuring it out as I go. And I’d love your feedback and ideas.
  2. I was thinking if you are a part of the label/collective, you would get your songs posted on the account and the people that follow will see the great music and probably say: “Hey! I like this music! I think I better check out these artists and follow them.”
    Thank you all for your feedback!

Read full topic

item.title: Auxy label in the works!
item.dc:creator: HYDRANS
item.description:
Sounds like you haven’t really thought this through very much. I’d suggest taking a lot more time to think about what you are trying to create and how you will do this.

Some questions you may want to think about:

  1. What is the goal/purpose of your label?
  2. How will it benefit artists directly and indirectly?
  3. How will you get maximum exposure for the artists releasing with the label?
  4. What community aspects will you have?
  5. How will you be able to keep the label active over long periods of time?

Some of these questions might not apply because I still don’t really understand what you’re trying to create but I’m assuming you are trying to make a label/artist collective based on the title of this topic

Read full topic

item.title: Auxy label in the works!
item.dc:creator: foryou
item.description:
if they’re not auxy users, then export wouldn’t work the same way as it does in auxy. you should get the app “documents by readdle”, it’s a smart way to save audio files and samples directly to your device. after you have it downloaded, i recommend having them send you the finished song as a .wav file. you should be able to open the file in the documents app and save it there. then go to soundcloud.com and click the upload option. from there, you should get 3 options for where to open the file from. click “browse”, and your saved song should show up in the documents app folder. then you could upload from there. it sounds like a lot of work, but it’s actually really easy to do and it will save a lot of time.

Read full topic
